notes: Masks compulsory at all times but can be open  https://web.archive.org/web/20200904202427/https://www.gov.bm/coronavirus-workplace

All visitors must undergo PCRCovid-19 testing on arrival at Bermuda L.F Wade International Airport and are expected to quarantine in their accommodation until test results are ready. Thereafter, they must take a further test on day four, day eight and day fourteen. Results of the PCR Covid-19 test will be emailed to you. Everyone should comply with the measures put in place in Bermuda to limit the spread of coronavirus (COVID-19).  https://web.archive.org/web/20200904202521/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/bermuda/coronavirus

still current, schools planning to open by province staggered in September     school bus rules have also been changed to limit the number of students in Quebec Province, with a list of bus eligible students, "The list prioritized students with special needs, kids who live in high traffic zones where it's dangerous to walk, younger students, and those who live farther away from school."    http://web.archive.org/web/20200827115904/https://globalnews.ca/news/7279680/back-to-school-coronavirus-canada/

Still current, transport is open with masks required and social distancing required     https://web.archive.org/web/20200827121316/https://tc.canada.ca/en/initiatives/covid-19-measures-updates-guidance-issued-transport-canada/covid-19-information-travellers

Limited and based on province - e.g. Manitoba still has a ban on evictions until September 30, 2020    http://web.archive.org/web/20200827122242/https://www.cmhc-schl.gc.ca/en/rental-housing/covid-19-eviction-bans-and-suspensions-to-support-renters

No change in policy found. Restrictions vary by province with some as strict as 10 people (Quebec)     http://web.archive.org/web/20200907162414/https://www.quebec.ca/en/health/health-issues/a-z/2019-coronavirus/gatherings-events-covid19/

Public transport open, masks required (to wear or to at least have with you) on air transport, rail transport, road transport, water transport, etc.     http://web.archive.org/web/20200907162106/https://tc.canada.ca/en/initiatives/covid-19-measures-updates-guidance-issued-transport-canada/covid-19-information-travellers
Still on a province basis, no major changes found   http://web.archive.org/web/20200907163921/https://www.canada.ca/en/services/benefits/ei/cerb-application.html
Still current, no change in policy found     http://web.archive.org/web/20200907161916/https://www.canada.ca/en/public-health/services/diseases/coronavirus-disease-covid-19.html

Yukon lifts its interprovincial ban as of September 4. "All residents of Canada can enter into Yukon, with some residents required to self-isolate."   https://web.archive.org/web/20200726235159if_/https://yukon.ca/en/health-and-wellness/covid-19-information/summary-yukons-plan-lifting-covid-19-restrictions    Provinces continue to make their own restrictions on internal movement, e.g. Manitoba & First Nations recently put a new ban in place to restrict travel to north: https://web.archive.org/save/https://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/manitoba/covid-19-manitoba-1.5706231

From NY subnational coding:    As of 25th August, the New York State public transport systems appear to be running, albeit with a reduced service (e.g. the New York City subway is not running between 1-5AM).   http://web.archive.org/web/20200825132208/https://new.mta.info/coronavirus

Travelers to New York from states with high case spread continue to require quarantine.      "A travel enforcement operation will commence at airports across the state to help ensure travelers are following the state's quarantine restrictions. As part of the enforcement operation, enforcement teams will be stationed at airports statewide to meet arriving aircrafts at gates and greet disembarking passengers to request proof of completion of the State Department of Health traveler form, which is being distributed to passengers by airlines prior to, and upon boarding or disembarking flights to New York State.     All out-of-state travelers from designated states must complete the form upon entering New York. Travelers who leave the airport without completing the form will be subject to a $2,000 fine and may be brought to a hearing and ordered to complete mandatory quarantine. Travelers coming to New York from designated states through other means of transport, including trains and cars, must fill out the form online."    https://web.archive.org/web/20200828020724/https://coronavirus.health.ny.gov/covid-19-travel-advisory?gclid=Cj0KCQjws536BRDTARIsANeUZ5-TVq-46_j7BATAdmTYAjY6oKpS8q7iebbTdfQmPIw6BbmG94ZbzAgaAmrKEALw_wcB
